Late Talker Support

Is your child not speaking as much as other children their age? You're not alone, and there's help available. Every child develops at their own pace, but sometimes a little extra support can make all the difference.

What is a Late Talker?

A late talker is typically a child who:

  • Has fewer than 50 words by age 2
  • Is not combining words by age 2.5
  • Has difficulty being understood by family members
  • Shows frustration when trying to communicate

How We Can Help

Our comprehensive approach includes:

  • Detailed assessment of your child's communication skills
  • Play-based therapy sessions that feel like fun
  • Parent coaching to support language development at home
  • Strategies to reduce communication frustration
  • Regular progress monitoring and plan adjustments

Ready to Get Started?

Early intervention makes a significant difference. The sooner we start, the better the outcomes.
